comments.body: A unrelated question, does anyone know why the folder is called "controller" instead of "replicationcontroller"?

If there's a good reason to not make this metadata consistent with autoscaling/v1 Scale, please add a comment.

I think the main thing to check is whether update conflicts could confuse the 1.1 HPA controller.
Also, this looks like it should be a helper since it's the same as Get.

> If there's a good reason to not make this metadata consistent with autoscaling/v1 Scale, please add a comment.

I have made some changes. I still need some clarification about this comment. I will talk to you about it.

> I think the main thing to check is whether update conflicts could confuse the 1.1 HPA controller.

The HPA code as it is right now can potentially confuse 1.1 HPA controller. This is because the Get and Update to Scale in HPA 1.1 completely ignored group/version, so the RC object here and in 1.1 HPA can point to the same underlying etcd object. I am not sure how to fix this problem though.

> Also, this looks like it should be a helper since it's the same as Get.

Pulled Scale object instantiation into a helper.
I'm not sure they were ignored... aren't they used in the decode/conversion, even if they aren't looked at by the HPA controller itself?

> I'm not sure they were ignored... aren't they used in the decode/conversion, even if they aren't looked at by the HPA controller itself?

That's correct.
Please also set rc.ResourceVersion, so they'll get a conflict error if they want one.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +158,162 @@		return nil, false, errors.NewNotFound(autoscaling.Resource("replicationcontrollers/scale"), scale.Name)
	}
	rc.Spec.Replicas = scale.Spec.Replicas
	rc.ResourceVersion = scale.ResourceVersion
	rc, err = r.registry.UpdateController(ctx, rc)
